name: T.J. Cinnamon Buns
recipeIngredient: 1/4 Cup (50 ml) lukewarm water temp. (105 to 115F)
2 Envelopes (1/4- ounce size) active dry yeast
4 -5 cups (1 to 1.25 liter) all - purpose flour
1/2 Cup (125 ml) Milk, scalded, then heated to 110F

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water and 1/2 teaspoon (2 ml) sugar in small bowl, add yeast, stir and let stand 3-5 minutes. Mixture should bubble up on top.

In a large mixing bowl, combine 3 cups of the flour with 1/3 cups sugar and 1 teaspoon salt. Make a well in the center of dry ingredients and add oil, eggs, scalded milk and yeast mixture. Blend well.
Add flour, 1/2 cup at a time until dough is smooth and leaves the sides of the bowl. You may not need all of the flour.

On a lightly floured surface, knead dough until elastic and satiny. Place in a large, lightly greased bowl, turning dough greased side up. Cover with a towel and let stand in a warm place until doubled in bulk.
Punch down dough and roll out on lightly floured surface into a rectangle about 10x18 inches. Spread evenly with filling.

Roll dough tightly into 18" log. Cut into 14 even sections. Place one roll each in center of two greased, 8-inch round cake pans and set other around them. Cover with a towel and let stand in a warm place until doubled.
